**英文版**

Email Subject:
A Concerned Football Fan on Junius Ho and Wilson Wong’s Presence at HKFA

Body text:

Paul Woodland
Chief Executive Officer
Hong Kong Football Association
55 Fat Kwong Street Homantin Hong Kong
hkfa@hkfa.com


Dear Mr. Paul Woodland,

I am writing to express my deep concern over the serious misconducts of two Hong Kong Football Association members—Mr. Junius Ho, Chairman of Legal Committee, and Mr. Wilson Wong, Club-Linked Director with seven additional Committee titles, in relation to recent social unrests. I ask that you seriously consider stripping these two members of their committee leadership positions.

Video and voice recordings by witnesses at the scene, readily available on social media, show Mr. Ho and Mr. Wong’s involvement in the mob attacks in Yuen Long on the 21st of July. Mr. Ho applauded and called the assailants “hero” shortly before the attacks on innocent civilians; while Mr. Wong aggressively trespassed a gated train station area among other assailants to pursue frightened citizens. As you know, the violent assault has not only caused nearly 50 reported cases of injuries, but also left the town residents scarred and terrorized. Mr. Ho and Mr. Wong’s possible incitement and evident participation in these attacks call for a serious questioning of the values (or the lack thereof) they represent.

The HKFA has had over one hundred years of reputable work in promoting the spirit of fair game in the football fields of Hong Kong. The Association’s Disciplinary Committee has established a professional code of conduct among players and judges to ensure each match is performed to its highest standard. I am profoundly dismayed that both Mr. Ho and Mr. Wong’s blatant display of violence and support for such violence has demonstrated opposite qualities to HKFA’s values. Their outrageous violation of public safety and their utter lack of humanity clearly indicate that both should be stripped of any seats in your committees, especially those in your Legal Committee.

As a football fan, I am extremely disturbed by the connection between the Association and Ho and Wong. I hope that the Association will restore its prestige by professing equal moral standard to all sportsmen and its committee members. Please kindly relate my concerns to your Management Committee and Board of Directors. Thank you for your time.

Yours sincerely,
XXX




**中文版**
Email subject:
香港球迷對香港足總成員何君堯先生及王威信先生之意見

Body text：

温達倫 (Paul Woodland)
香港足球總會秘書處行政總裁
九龍何文田佛光街55號
hkfa@hkfa.com


溫達倫先生：


鑑於貴會兩名成員牽涉近日社會連串嚴重違規行為，本人深表憤慨，特此來函。二人為法律事務委員會主席何君堯先生，以及董事暨七委員會之主席、副主席、召集人兼成員王威信先生。懇請閣下認真考慮撤回二人在貴會持有之重要職銜。

網上流傳多段由目撃者提供的影片及録音，顯示何、王二人牽涉7月21日之元朗恐襲。據影片所示，當晚何與襲擊者握手並稱對方為「英雄」，王則與其他襲擊者激烈闖進西鐵站並疑似追撃市民。是次暴力事件不僅導致近50個受傷個案，更令元朗居民陷入恐慌及遺留創傷。何、王二人對事件之疑似煽動及參與令人對其（存在與否之）價值觀深表質疑。

香港足總有逾百年歷史，對推動公平公正的體育精神不遺餘力。貴會之紀律委員會對球員及裁判員制定嚴格的紀律章程，務求令每場賽事得以發揮至最高水平。然而何、王二人涉及暴力事件，正正與貴會所秉持之優良價值大相違背。為此本人感到非常失望及震驚。此等有損社會安寧的暴力行為，反映二人道德淪喪，絕不適合在貴會執行任何尤與法律相關之職務。

作為球迷，本人對貴會與何、王二人之聯繫深感不安，望貴會能對全體成員一律展示對運動員所訂下同等程度的道德標準，保障貴會聲譽及公信力，去蕪存菁，整頓團隊，賽事報捷之餘仍持守道德操守，敢於向「鄉黑」說不，佇候賜覆，不勝感激！


謹祝
政通人和

香港球迷XXX上
